marketNews.title: US Stocks & Bitcoin Print All-Time High
marketNews.content: Two major US indices - S&P 500 and Nasdaq - printed new all-time high records in Thursday's (10/7) trading, closing up at levels of 6,280.46 (+0.27%) and 20,630.67 (+0.09%) respectively. This rise was partly driven by the strengthening stock price of Nvidia (Nasdaq: NVDA) by +1.22%, marking the first public company record to hold a market cap of 4 trillion US dollars. At a similar time, Bitcoin also recorded an all-time high to the level of ~$118 thousand as investors resumed taking risk-on positions. The rise in US stock exchanges and Bitcoin was primarily caused by the majority of traders beginning to ignore concerns over trade tariffs announced by President Donald Trump. Chief Strategist at Interactive Brokers, Steve Sosnick, said that most market participants do not pay attention to news about tariffs until the tariffs are actually enacted, considering that it is still possible for the tariffs to be renegotiated, postponed, or modified if there is a reasonable cause. Meanwhile, in the Asian market, the South Korean index (KOSPI) also recorded an all-time high in today's trading, Friday (11/7), and has risen +32.4% YTD. This makes KOSPI the best performing Asian market since the beginning of the year. Here is the performance of Asian markets, including Indonesia, sorted from highest:

marketNews.title: Key Takeaway
marketNews.content: Generally, the rally in the US and South Korean markets was primarily driven by high market participant enthusiasm for the artificial intelligence (AI) trend, which seems to outweigh concerns about US tariff policies. For Indonesia itself, concerns about economic fundamentals and national growth prospects cause low foreign investor interest currently, in our view. We assess that the acceleration of government spending in 2H25 will be a key factor to boost the economy in the short term. Additionally, investors also need to closely monitor the development of Indonesia's trade agreements with the US.

marketNews.title: Cash Burning Company: A Condition That Holds Many Stories
marketNews.content: "No matter how good the product, how sophisticated the technology owned, or how high the profit figures displayed in the financial statements, without healthy cash flow, a business is just waiting for time to stumble." - parahitairawan

tickerNews.title: MTEL & TBIG Reportedly Plan to Merge Again
tickerNews.content: Bloomberg reported that Dayamitra Telekomunikasi is reconsidering merging with Tower Bersama Infrastructure, after the previous plan failed in 2015. Bloomberg sources said that the two companies have held initial discussions with potential advisors regarding a potential merger that could create an entity valued at approximately 90 trillion Rupiah. Nevertheless, Bloomberg sources mentioned that considerations regarding this corporate action are still in the early stages, and there is no certainty whether the plan will be realized. Representatives of MTEL and TBIG have not commented on this issue, while Telkom Indonesia (MTEL's controller) declined to comment.

tickerNews.title: TPIA's subsidiary's CA-EDC project may receive investment from Danantara's initial loan drawdown
tickerNews.content: Reuters reported that the 800 million US dollar Chlor-Alkali and Ethylene Dichloride (CA-EDC) plant project owned by a subsidiary of Chandra Asri Pacific is likely to be one of the parties receiving investment from Danantara through an initial loan drawdown of 3 billion US dollars. This initial loan is part of a multi-currency loan of up to 10 billion US dollars from several foreign banks to Danantara. Previously, Danantara and Indonesia Investment Authority (INA) in June 2025 had signed a memorandum of understanding with TPIA to explore the possibility of entering as a new investor in the CA-EDC plant project.

tickerNews.title: Astra International's Automobile Wholesale Sales Decline in June 2025
tickerNews.content: Astra International recorded automobile wholesale sales of 29,365 units in June 2025 (-33% YoY, -15% MoM). This result brought ASII's wholesale for 1H25 to 201,633 units (-13% YoY), with market share decreasing to 53.8% (vs. 1H24: 56.5%).

tickerNews.title: Solusi Sinergi Digital Posts Strong Net Profit Growth in 2Q25
tickerNews.content: Solusi Sinergi Digital recorded a net profit of 145 billion Rupiah in 2Q25 (+140% YoY, +76% QoQ). This result brought the net profit for 1H25 to reach 228 billion Rupiah (+154% YoY). The performance in 2Q25 was supported by revenue growth (+67% YoY, +22% QoQ), thus increasing all profit margins. In 2Q25, gross profit margin rose to 77.4% (vs. 1Q25: 75.3%, 2Q24: 58.8%), operating profit margin rose to 85.6% (vs. 1Q25: 59.4%, 2Q24: 49.7%), and net profit margin rose to 51.6% (vs. 1Q25: 35.7%, 2Q24: 35.7%).

tickerNews.title: PT Pesona Sukses Cemerlang reduces share ownership in Amman Mineral Internasional
tickerNews.content: The ownership of PT Pesona Sukses Cemerlang in Amman Mineral Internasional decreased by 160 million (0.22%) shares, based on KSEI data as of July 9, 2025. The transaction value is unknown. This transaction caused the ownership of PT Pesona Sukses Cemerlang in AMMN to drop from 6.52% to 6.3%.

tickerNews.title: PT Madhani Talatah Nusantara sells DEWA shares for approximately 27 Billion Rupiah
tickerNews.content: Darma Henwa shareholder, PT Madhani Talatah Nusantara, sold approximately 361.4 million DEWA shares on July 7, 2025, at a price of 75 Rupiah per share. The total transaction reached approximately 27 billion Rupiah. After this transaction, the ownership of PT Madhani Talatah Nusantara decreased from 21.96% to 21.07%. Previously, PT Madhani Talatah Nusantara had sold about 666.7 million DEWA shares in June 2025 and about 493.3 million shares in April 2025, each at a price of 75 Rupiah per share.

tickerNews.title: Energi Mega Persada subsidiary signs MoU for Carbon Capture and Storage Development in Arun Field
tickerNews.content: Energi Mega Persada announced that its business entity, PT Pema Global Energi, signed a memorandum of understanding with PT Pupuk Indonesia regarding the plan for developing carbon capture storage and carbon capture utilization storage facilities in the "B" work area, which includes the Arun gas field in Aceh. ENRG stated that the Arun gas field is estimated to be able to store around 10 trillion cubic feet or 504 million tons of CO2.

tickerNews.title: FKS Multi Agro plans 1:10 stock split
tickerNews.content: FKS Multi Agro plans to conduct a stock split with a ratio of 1:10. The trading schedule for the shares with the new nominal value in the regular and negotiation markets will be on September 10, 2025. This corporate action will be discussed in the EGM on August 19, 2025.

tickerNews.title: Danantara's Multi-Currency Loan and JBIC Cooperation
tickerNews.content: Reuters reported that the multi-currency loan of up to 10 billion US dollars obtained by Danantara from several foreign banks has an interest rate equivalent to the yield of Indonesian government bonds, with a 3-year tenor. 5 foreign banks have been appointed as coordinators for this credit facility, which will be the largest loan in Southeast Asian history, where each bank also commits to lending 1 billion US dollars unsecured and without government guarantees. Danantara on Friday (11/7) announced that it has signed a memorandum of understanding with the Japan Bank for International Cooperation (JBIC) to jointly finance renewable energy, water management, and electricity transmission projects in Indonesia. There are no further details yet regarding this cooperation.

tickerNews.title: State-owned Banks to provide goods-based loans to cooperatives, Presidential target for 80k village cooperatives by Dec 2025
tickerNews.content: The Deputy at the Coordinating Ministry for Food Affairs, Tatang Yuliono, said that the state-owned bank holding (Himbara) will provide loans with a ceiling of 3 billion Rupiah per Red and White village cooperative in the form of procurement of goods, not cash. This step is taken to prevent potential fraud in cooperative management. Meanwhile, the Minister of Cooperatives, Budi Arie Setiadi, stated that President Prabowo Subianto targets approximately 80 thousand village cooperatives to be fully operational by December 2025.

tickerNews.title: Philippine Nickel Ore Shipments to Indonesia Expected to Surge
tickerNews.content: Shipments of nickel ore from the Philippines to Indonesia are expected to surge this year to meet the demand of smelters due to production restrictions in Indonesia, according to Tulsi Das Reyes, President at DCMI Mining. Reyes told Bloomberg that Philippine nickel ore exports to Indonesia are likely to increase to around 5-10 million tons in 2025, up from the 2023 realization in the range of 1 million tons. Reyes estimates that the trend of increased nickel ore exports from the Philippines to Indonesia is unlikely to last long, but is predicted to remain stable.

tickerNews.title: Goldman Sachs Predicts 5x Aluminum Production Increase in Indonesia Driven by Chinese Investment
tickerNews.content: Bloomberg reported that Goldman Sachs Group Inc. estimates Indonesia's aluminum production could increase 5 times by the end of this decade as investments from Chinese tycoons - such as Tsingshan Holding Group Co., China Hongqiao Group Ltd., and Shandong Nanshan Aluminum Co. - come in to build new smelters. Alan Clark, Director at metal consulting firm CM Group, told Bloomberg that Indonesia will become a global aluminum industry hub in the next 5 years, supported by cheap labor and Philippine coal-fired power plants that can support the sizeable smelter industry.

tickerNews.title: Dana Brata Luhur (TEBE) Management Resignation Plan to be Discussed in EGM
tickerNews.content: Dana Brata Luhur (TEBE) announced that Dian Heryandi and Hendy Narindra Dewantoro have submitted resignation letters from their respective positions as President Director and Director of the company. This plan will be discussed at the upcoming General Meeting of Shareholders (GMS) on August 13, 2025.

tickerNews.title: Jaya Real Property (JRPT) Resumes Share Buyback Plan
tickerNews.content: Jaya Real Property (JRPT) plans again to execute a share buyback of up to 100 million (~0.78%) shares in the period of July 10 - October 9, 2025. The allocation of funds for this buyback is 80 billion Rupiah. This plan does not require GMS approval, following the relaxation provided by OJK to support capital market stability. Previously, JRPT had reported the results of the buyback for the period of April 9 - July 8, 2025, where JRPT purchased 23.3 million shares at an average price of 708 Rupiah per share or totaling 16.5 billion Rupiah.
